definition.name: NXchemical_composition

symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays.

symbol.name: n
symbol.doc: The number of samples or things.

definition.doc: Chemical composition of a sample or a set of things.

field.name: normalization
field.doc: Reporting compositions as atom and weight percent yields both dimensionless quantities but their conceptual interpretation differs. A normalization based on atom_percent counts relative to the total number of atoms which are of a particular type. By contrast, weight_percent normalization factorizes in the respective mass of the elements. Software libraries that work with units, like pint in Python, are challenged by these differences as at.-% and wt.-% are both fractional quantities.

field.name: total
field.doc: Total formula mass or number of atoms, depending on the normalization stated in the normalization field.

group.name: ELEMENT
group.doc: If this group is used to report the composition of elements from the periodic table, the group should use the chemical symbol of that element. For other case the group name is unconstrained.

field.name: amount
field.doc: Count or weight which, when divided by total yields the composition of this element, isotope, molecule, or ion.

field.name: composition
field.doc: Composition value for the element/ion referred to under name. Composition is reported either normalized for atomic or weight percent. The field normalization should be used to communicate this explicitly. Composition should be reported consistently for all instances ELEMENT.

field.name: composition_errors
field.doc: Magnitude of the standard deviation of the composition.
